basics.name: Daniel Ilies
basics.label: Data & Software Engineer | Data Pipelines, AI/ML, Cloud Infrastructure
basics.summary: Software Engineer with a strong focus on data systems and over 3 years of experience designing, building, and deploying data-driven applications. Proven ability in creating end-to-end data pipelines using Python and TensorFlow, and managing the underlying infrastructure with Docker and CI/CD. Experienced in backend development (Node.js, Go) and collaborating with stakeholders to translate complex requirements into robust technical solutions.

work.name: DevelBox
work.summary: Developed and maintained data-centric applications and ML infrastructure in a production environment, focusing on data processing pipelines and systems integration.
highlights: Designed and implemented an end-to-end ML data pipeline for an ad detection system, managing the process from Python/TensorFlow model training to in-browser deployment with TensorFlow.js.
Managed a Linux-based data processing and model training infrastructure using Flask, Docker, and CI/CD, ensuring system reliability and monitoring model performance with TensorBoard.
Contributed to architectural decisions, performed code reviews, and collaborated with cross-functional teams to integrate data-driven features into user-facing applications.
Engineered a robotics control system integrating NVIDIA Isaac Sim with OpenAI APIs, demonstrating experience with modern AI services and complex system integrations.

work.name: CGS Romania
work.summary: Developed an award-winning internal tool to automate repetitive data entry and communication tasks, enhancing operational efficiency and accuracy.
highlights: Won 1st place in the company's Innovation Contest for 'Otis', a JavaScript-based tool that automated form-filling and email generation, significantly improving team productivity.

work.name: Trood
work.summary: Contributed to a microservices-based platform, developing backend components and API integrations.
highlights: Developed backend services in Go, implementing gRPC endpoints for efficient inter-service communication and data serialization.

courses: Bachelor Thesis: Building a Modern Fullstack Web Application

awards.title: 1st Place Innovation Contest
awards.summary: Awarded for creating 'Otis', an automation tool that streamlined data handling and internal workflows, significantly improving team efficiency.

projects.name: AdCognition â€“ End-to-End ML Ad Detection System
projects.description: Production system for real-time ad detection, featuring a Python/TensorFlow training stack, model conversion to TFJS, and a TensorFlow.js model deployed in a Chrome extension for in-browser inference.
highlights: Built a complete ML pipeline: data ingestion and model training in Python, TFJS export, and browser-side deployment.
Implemented Flask services for model hosting and conversion, with monitoring via TensorBoard.
Achieved over 90% detection accuracy in production scenarios.
